basics.name: Sebastian Ruiz
basics.summary: Currently a student at Florida State University. Interested in computational modeling methods applied to neuroscience and psychiatry.

highlights: Supervisors: Assistant Professor of Statistics Partha Sarkar, Ph.D. (Florida State University), Assistant Professor of Psychiatry and Human Behavior, Mohamed Sherif, M.D., Ph.D (Brown University and Lifespan Physician Group).

Duties included: Examine effects of sensory noise degradation on model behavior, and how it can be abstracted to represent psychiatric illnesses. Review recently published literature on the Thousand Brains System, Active Inference, and Predictive Coding.
Supervisors: Assistant Professor of Psychiatry and Human Behavior, Mohamed Sherif, M.D., Ph.D.

education.area: B.S. in Statistics with Minors in Computational Science and Psychology
courses: Computational Methods in Statistics, Computational Probabilistic Modeling, Fundamentals of Neuroscience, Calculus I-III, Linear Algebra, Symbolic and Numerical Computation, Programming for Science Applications
